p: Plant-plant interactions (e.g., facilitation and competition) play an important role in both facilitating and impeding species coexistence and the development of the forest community ( Ibáñez and Rodríguez, 2020),which may depend on resource availability ( Forrester et al., 2011). The functional compatibility or complementarity of mycorrhizal types plants, through culturing specific functional groups of soil microbes, contribute to relieve interspecific competition and promote species coexistence ( Teste et al., 2014).
